tool_spec.name: Query Support Analytics
tool_spec.description: Analyze customer support tickets by product area, client type, resolution metrics, and team performance. Identify support trends and areas needing attention.

sample_questions.question: Which product areas generate the most customer support tickets?
sample_questions.expected_insight: Claims Processing and Denial Management typically generate 50%+ of all tickets

sample_questions.question: What's the average resolution time by product area?
sample_questions.expected_insight: Simple how-to questions resolve in 2-4 hours, complex bugs take 24-48 hours

sample_questions.question: Which client types submit the most support tickets?
sample_questions.expected_insight: Hospitals and large physician groups typically have higher ticket volumes

sample_questions.question: Are support tickets increasing or decreasing over time?
sample_questions.expected_insight: Shows seasonal patterns and impact of new feature releases

sample_questions.question: What's our customer satisfaction score by support team?
sample_questions.expected_insight: Customer Success team typically has highest satisfaction scores

sample_questions.question: Which features have the most bugs reported?
How many critical tickets are still open?
sample_questions.expected_insight: Shows current critical issues requiring immediate attention

sample_questions.question: What's the escalation rate by product area?
sample_questions.expected_insight: Complex features like integrations have higher escalation rates

instructions_addition.response: When analyzing support ticket data, always segment by product area and client type. Highlight high-priority items like critical tickets and escalated issues. Provide actionable insights for product improvement.
instructions_addition.orchestration: For support analytics questions, focus on identifying patterns that indicate product issues, training needs, or process improvements. Always include resolution time metrics and customer satisfaction when available.
